snippet: Over two dozen reservists in Southern California have been charged in a scheme of submitting fake travel vouchers that totaled more than $870,000, authorities said.
abstract: More than two dozen Marine Corps reservists stationed in Southern California are charged in a scheme of submitting fake travel vouchers totaling more than $870,000; authorities say scheme’s main facilitator was a military administrative officer Bladimir Flores.
lead_paragraph: Over two dozen reservists in Southern California have been charged in a scheme of submitting fake travel vouchers that totaled more than $870,000, authorities said.

headline.main: California: Marine Corps Reservists Accused of Travel Swindle
headline.print_headline: California: Marine Corps Reservists Are Accused of Travel Swindle

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
